Articles.Content:
May I present the Orbital Debris Elimination Network, brought to you by Joshmo United Aerospace, and MechJeb.

Here we have a unit ready for launch.

Gravity turn for 200 km orbit.

Acquiring target.

Destroying it\'s final positioning rocket.

The unblinking eye of MechJeb.

The finished network - 13 satellites.

Satellites can be redirected in moments to deal with debris. Should two or more units come within 2 km of each other, they are programmed to fight to the death. Better to lose one than both. The destroyed satellite will be quickly replaced with a new one. There are currently a lot of detractors pointing out that most of the debris currently in orbit was in fact put there by the ODEN project, but we will have things cleaned up in short order, and they will stay that way. No Kessler Syndrome for us!

Oh, and mot to worry, we have taken steps to ensure the drones only shoot down debris. We are almost positive they won\'t attack complete ships.

Add-ons include MechJeb, and Sunbeam Laser. All else is stock. .craft file if anyone cares.

EDIT: Added persistence file.

When we attempted a software update to upgrade the drones to a global defense network, the satellites showed a marked inability to discern between an unmanned missile, and a manned science vessel. The entire network will have to be scrapped and re-deployed - if we can get them down from there that is.
